subject.name: IT Workshop
subject.description: A practical course designed to provide students with hands-on skills in computer hardware, software tools, internet usage, and office productivity applications including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and LaTeX.
objectives: Understand the components and peripherals of a computer system and their functions.
Develop basic troubleshooting and maintenance skills for computer hardware.
Gain practical knowledge of internet tools, web browsers, and safe browsing practices.
Learn to use productivity software such as MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and LaTeX for document and data management.

units.title: PC Hardware
topics: Identification of computer peripherals and components
CPU architecture and functions
Block diagram of CPU with configuration details
Functions of motherboard and peripherals
Assembling and disassembling of PC
Installation of operating systems
Basic Linux commands

units.title: Internet
topics: Web browsers and accessing websites
Surfing the web and using search engines
Customization of browsers and proxy settings
Bookmarks, search toolbars, and pop-up blockers
Antivirus types and web protection measures

units.title: Microsoft Word
topics: Overview of MS Word features
Usage of hyperlinks, symbols, spell check, and track changes
Creating tables of content and newspaper columns
Inserting images, using clipart and drawing tools
Formatting text, paragraphs, and images
Mail merge and document design
Creating project certificates, abstracts, newsletters, and resumes

units.title: LaTeX
topics: Overview of LaTeX and comparison with MS Word and FOSS tools
Accessing toolbars, saving files, and using resources
Formatting fonts, drop caps, text effects, borders, and colors
Creating headers, footers, and inserting date/time options
Project creation in LaTeX and Word
Formatting styles, inserting tables and bullet points
Newsletter creation and advanced text formatting
Spell check, track changes, and mail merge integration

units.title: Microsoft Excel
topics: Overview of Excel features, formulas, and functions
Conditional formatting and charts
Hyperlinking, renaming, and inserting worksheets
Data analysis and scheduling with Excel tools
Creating and formatting GPA calculators using cell references and formulas

units.title: Microsoft PowerPoint
topics: Overview of PowerPoint features
Inserting images, transitions, and animations
Custom animations and hyperlink integration

suggested_books: The Complete Computer Upgrade and Repair Book, Cheryl A. Schmidt, 3rd Edition, WILEY Dreamtech
Introduction to Information Technology, ITL Education Solutions Limited, Pearson Education
PC Hardware – A Handbook, Kate J., Chase PHI
LaTeX Beginner’s Guide, Stefan Kottwitz, Packt Publishing
